image.title: The latest news from News Center.

item.title: Tupperware open house
item.creator: eflumerf
item.description: We are hosting a Tupperware open house. Stop by to see what is new with Tupperware! Everyone is welcome, snacks will be provided. There will be demonstrations of Tupperware products, as well as door prizes and raffles. Event is Saturday, Jan. 16 from 1-4 PM, in Warrenville (just outside the lab) For more information, call (727) 430-5913, email eflumerf@fnal.gov, or see my.Tupperware.com/JFlumerfelt
item.comment: We are hosting a Tupperware open house. Stop by to see what is new with Tupperware! Everyone is welcome, snacks will be provided. There will be demonstrations of Tupperware products, as well as door prizes and raffles. Event is Saturday, Jan. 16 from 1-4 PM, in Warrenville (just outside the lab) For more information, call (727) 430-5913, email eflumerf@fnal.gov , or see my.Tupperware.com/JFlumerfelt

item.title: Society of Philosophy, open discussion on the last two talks
item.creator: burov
item.description: Next meeting of the Fermi Society of Philosophy will be Thu, Jan 14, 12:00, at Req. Room (WH4NW). We’ll have an open discussion of the last two talks: 1. “Experiment in physics. Early views”; 2. “Atheism of Richard Feynman”. Slides of both talks are at our site https://fermisocietyofphilosophy.wordpress.com/ . Think about your questions, comments, objections and compliments . Everybody is welcome. Feel free to come with your lunch. Ask Alexey burov@fnal.gov if any questions.
item.comment: Next meeting of the Fermi Society of Philosophy will be Thu, Jan 14, 12:00, at Req. Room (WH4NW). We’ll have an open discussion of the last two talks: 1. “Experiment in physics. Early views”; 2. “Atheism of Richard Feynman”. Slides of both talks are at our site https://fermisocietyofphilosophy.wordpress.com/ . Think about your questions, comments, objections and compliments . Everybody is welcome. Feel free to come with your lunch. Ask Alexey burov@fnal.gov if any questions.

item.title: Free health screenings for active Fermilab employees
item.creator: jkoester
item.description: Free Health Screenings for Active Fermilab Employees on January 12 and January 13 from 7:30 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. at the Training Center. This screening offers active employees an opportunity to have their cholesterol, blood glucose, blood pressure and body composition checked. You will meet one-on-one with a Health Coach to review results, ask questions, and discuss health and wellness resources.
item.comment:
Free Health Screenings for Active Fermilab Employees on January 12 and January 13 from 7:30 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. at the Training Center. This screening offers active employees an opportunity to have their cholesterol, blood glucose, blood pressure and body composition checked. You will meet one-on-one with a Health Coach to review results, ask questions, and discuss health and wellness resources.

A reminder email will be sent to you. This 25-minute health screening is voluntary, confidential and offered at no charge to active employees. Your test results will not be shared with your company. To schedule your health screening* appointment, register at https://www.hsscreeningreg.com and enter the following username (fermi) and password (healthy). Employees that signed up last year should then continue as an Existing Customer using their Fermi email and ID# (digits only).

* Worksite Wellness events and screening are conducted by Interactive Health, a third party vendor. The information you receive at health screenings or worksite wellness events is intended to complement – not take the place of – the recommendations of your health care provider. Consult your physician before making major changes in your lifestyle or health care regimen. Well on Target is a registered mark of Health Care Service Corporation, a Mutual Legal Reserve Company. Contact Jeanne in the Wellness Office at jecker@fnal.gov or x2548 for more information.

item.title: Chez Leon lunch and dinner cancelled for Jan. 13 and 15

item.comment: The Chez Leon lunch scheduled for Wednesday, January 13, and the Chez Leon dinner scheduled for January 15 are cancelled.

item.title: In memoriam: Chuck Andrle
item.creator: awalters
item.description: Fermilab retiree Chuck Andrle passed away January 7, 2016, in Lombard.
item.comment:
Fermilab retiree Chuck Andrle passed away January 7, 2016, in Lombard. Chuck retired from the Fermilab Computing Division in 1996 after 27 years of service as the Manager of the Instrument Repair Department closely associated with PREP (Physics Research Equipment Pool). Prior to working at Fermilab, Chuck was employed at Argonne National Laboratory.

At Fermilab, he supervised and mentored dozens of electronic technicians that supported high-energy physics (HEP) equipment used in Fixed-Target experiments and test beams. Chuck was a founding member of the Association for Research Electronic Pools, otherwise known as AFREP, an organization consisting of representatives of electronic equipment pools within the HEP laboratories worldwide.

He is remembered as an employee who had a great sense of humor, thoroughly enjoyed his work, and enthusiastically helped colleagues and the Physics program. See Adams, Winterfield & Sullivan Funeral Home for arrangements: http://www.adamswinterfieldsullivan.com/

item.title: Spencer Pasero is new head of Education Office
item.creator: leah
item.description: On Jan. 1, Spencer Pasero became the new head of the Office of Education and Public Outreach, formerly the Education Office.
item.comment:
Spencer Pasero

On Jan. 1, Spencer Pasero became the new head of the Office of Education and Public Outreach, formerly the Education Office. He takes over from Marge Bardeen, who served as the head of the office for 20 years. She will continue to advance Fermilab’s education and outreach efforts as spokesperson and co-principal investigator of the QuarkNet Collaboration.

Pasero has been with the Education Office for 17 years, most recently, as an education program leader. He has been instrumental in organizing events such as the Fermilab Family Open House and the STEM Career Expo, as well as ongoing programs such as the laboratory’s summer internships and teacher workshops in physical science.

item.title: House for rent
